title: Simple Epidemic Spread Simulation
description: Simulate the spread of a virus in a population of 1000 people using an agent-based approach, modeling individuals' health status and interactions leading to transmission.

interactions.name: Contact and Transmission
interactions.description: When a Person in the 'Infected' state comes into contact with a Person in the 'Susceptible' state, the Susceptible Person may transition to the 'Infected' state with a certain probability.

metrics.name: susceptible_count
metrics.description: The number of individuals in the 'Susceptible' state at each time step.

metrics.name: infected_count
metrics.description: The number of individuals in the 'Infected' state at each time step.

metrics.name: recovered_count
metrics.description: The number of individuals in the 'Recovered' state at each time step.

metrics.name: total_infections
metrics.description: The cumulative number of individuals who have entered the 'Infected' state throughout the simulation.

metrics.name: peak_infected_count
metrics.description: The maximum number of individuals in the 'Infected' state observed during the simulation.

validation_criteria.name: population_conservation
validation_criteria.description: The sum of Susceptible, Infected, and Recovered individuals should remain constant and equal to the initial population size throughout the simulation (assuming no births/deaths/migration).

validation_criteria.name: valid_state_transitions
validation_criteria.description: State transitions should only occur from Susceptible to Infected and from Infected to Recovered, based on the defined rules (contact for S->I, time for I->R).

validation_criteria.name: epidemic_curve_qualitative_shape
validation_criteria.description: For parameters leading to an outbreak (transmission_probability and contacts_per_person_per_step are sufficiently high relative to infection_duration_steps), the 'infected_count' metric should typically show an initial rise, a peak, and a subsequent decline.

validation_criteria.name: parameter_sensitivity_check
validation_criteria.description: Increasing the 'transmission_probability' or 'contacts_per_person_per_step' should generally lead to a larger and/or faster outbreak (higher peak, shorter time to peak).
